s.text: 5 Hunkering Down: For the rest of the week I follow a modified limited-hangout strategy, saying things like, we'll just have to wait and see, the evidence isn't in yet, we just aren't in a position to explain anything more.

4 Well-Timed Distraction: It's Tuesday, and when the State of the Union message comes on at 9:00 p.m., I eagerly give in when the kids plead from their beds to be allowed to come out and watch a little.

That was the perplexed comment that greeted my first halting efforts to explain the Clinton scandal to my children, ages 6 and 9. I promptly began quoting the profundity to my friends and reflecting indignantly, along with the rest of America, on what a poor role model the overgrown youth in the White House is for our youth.

That was the perplexed comment that greeted my first halting efforts to explain the Clinton scandal to my children, ages 6 and 9. I promptly began quoting the profundity to my friends and reflecting indignantly, along with the rest of America, on what a poor role model the overgrown youth in the White House is for our youth.

That was the perplexed comment that greeted my first halting efforts to explain the Clinton scandal to my children, ages 6 and 9. I promptly began quoting the profundity to my friends and reflecting indignantly, along with the rest of America, on what a poor role model the overgrown youth in the White House is for our youth.

That was the perplexed comment that greeted my first halting efforts to explain the Clinton scandal to my children, ages 6 and 9. I promptly began quoting the profundity to my friends and reflecting indignantly, along with the rest of America, on what a poor role model the overgrown youth in the White House is for our youth.
I'm quite sure my children know they're not getting the full version of events.
That's easy, since they find the friend with the secret tape recorder fascinating.
